abstracts.cdata!:
The Sichuan Agricultural Development
            Project has successfully achieved its objectives. Lessons
            learned based on the review of the implementation completion
            report mission include: 1) Strong, stable, and consistent
            management is the basis for successful project
            implementation. 2) Close attention to development of sound
            plans for operation and maintenance from preparation onwards
            can be of great benefit during project operation. 3) Where
            conveyance systems are complex the independent review of
            designs and optimization of designs can provide significant
            cost savings. 4) Use of contractors on contracts giving the
            contractor responsibility for machinery and material supply
            can have significant advantages in cost and timeliness. 5)
            Project staff should receive more substantial training in
            contract management, international competitive bidding, and
            world Bank procurement procedures at or before project
            commencement. 6) Sustainable revolving funds cannot be
            operated successfully or be sustained if their lending rates
            are not competitive with mainstream credit institutions. 7)
            Current on-lending arrangements to prefectures, counties,
            and townships for research and training activities that are
            limited revenue generating potentials can constrain
            implementation of important research activities.
